instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00045: What is 820-00045? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Switch off after login password.
threads.message:
No liquid damage.
Was dead then I found two coils was cracked L1275 and L1270.
Replaced both of them and is alive again but there an issue: switch off after I enter password.
Same on external system.

Any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Switch off after login password.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R1270</RESISTOR>/75/80 are all good (0 ohm)?

Does it switch off immediately after type the password?
Does it stay on if you let it waiting for password?

Disconnect any peripherals and try again.

Also you can try reinstall OSX, if there is no important data.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Switch off after login password.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R1270</RESISTOR>/75/80 all at 0 Ohm.

"Does it switch off immediately after type the password?"
No, there is progress bar. It looks like it switch off when desktop should be visible.

"Does it stay on if you let it waiting for password?"
Yes

If trackpad flex is not connected then all works fine.

Clients MacBook is 2015.
Connected trackpad and trackpad cable from 2016 and once boot was with success.
Tried 10 times more ans same issue.

Tested with connected and disconnected keyboard flex.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Switch off after login password.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Switch off after login password.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Switch off after login password.
threads.message:
Could be BIOS issue...
Try first USB OSX, using USB mouse/keyboard too.
Disconnect everything from MLB, except LCD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00045</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Switch off after login password.
threads.message: Hi, recently I had the same type of issue and the guys here recommended the trackpad. I tried witha replacment trackpad and cable to no avail. customer took the laptop to the apple store and they deduced it was the trackpad. however, when the customer got the laptop back theyn had charged for an OUT OF WARRANTY repar for a replacement logicboard. Not saying this is the issue here but might be worth considering.A lso the trackpad I was using was good but the cable bad.  Might be worth trying a 2nd known good 2015 trackpad and cable first.
